intro: Orbexilum pedunculatum, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Orbexilum pedunculatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
